channel.title: hollowbyakuya7@gmail.com's Pocket Saves
channel.description: RSS feed of hollowbyakuya7@gmail.com's saved articles from Pocket

item.title: ‘I’m So Angry All the Time’
item.description: This column first ran in John Paul Brammer’s Hola Papi newsletter, which you can subscribe to on Substack. I’m facing a reality that I can’t avoid anymore: I’m angry. I’m angry at everything. I’m angry at the world, and at the people that live in it.

item.title: Your Android Phone's Web Browser Has Junk Files You Can Delete Now
item.description: Your Android phone's web browser picks up a lot of files, images and data from the websites that you visit, and a lot of that does not need to be on your phone.

item.title: Here's How You Can Stop Google From Following You on Vacation
item.description: You'd probably be a little creeped out if someone kept track of where you went for vacation, right? Believe it or not, that's what Google and other companies routinely do online.

item.title: 5 Apps That Are Better on the Desktop Than in Your Browser
item.description: Many of us use browser tabs to run our most frequented apps: media players, instant messengers, office suites, and more. But while this often means we can take our favorite services anywhere without installing anything, the web version of an app is not necessarily better.

item.title: The 80 Best Micro Habits to Change Your Life
item.description: What's one tiny thing you can do every day to change your life for the better? You might think that such a small change wouldn't make much of a difference, but nothing could be further from the truth. When it comes to making lasting changes in our lives, it's the little things that count.

item.title: Is a new kind of religion forming on the internet?
item.description: Algorithms are surfacing content that combines Christian ideas like prosperity gospel with New Age and non-Western spirituality — along with some conspiracy theories. “It just doesn’t sit right with me,” begins a TikTok by a user named Evelyn Juarez.

item.title: A Nobel prize-winner explained his simple technique for learning anything quickly and effectively
item.description: Physicist Richard Feynman believed that simplicity was the key to learning.

item.title: The 11 Cognitive Distortions That Are Making You a Miserable SOB
item.description: Does it feel like the world is out to get you? Does it seem like everyone you know is an a-hole?

item.title: 7 Toxic Phrases People In Relationships Say Without Realizing It
item.description: In our closest relationships, it’s easy to speak without thinking. It seems like a good thing: We’re so comfortable with each other we can share whatever is on our mind. But sometimes it can have a negative effect.

item.title: 4 Simple Practices to Help Train You to Really, Truly Live in the Moment
item.description: Just be present. Live in the moment. It’s advice you hear and see everywhere. And you probably say it to yourself often, too, as it helps you focus on what’s happening in real time. You don’t deny the mindfulness approach or its upside. It’s no-tech. It slows you down.

item.title: Your Smartphone Photos Take up Too Much Space. Here’s How to Downsize Them.
item.description: It’s all about balancing compression with quality.

item.title: The Social Basis of the Woman Question
item.description: Source: abstract from Selected Writings of Alexandra Kollontai, Allison & Busby, 1977;First Published: 1909, as a pamphlet;Translated and Edited: by Alix Holt;Transcribed: for marxists.org;Proofed: and corrected by Chris Clayton 2006.
